data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One should always face forward no matter how it is used. So, the answer is no.

Turn around means returning home. Take 4 steps then go to right. The first statement is about turn right. So, the answer is No.

When you turn around, you take a new approach and take 6 steps and 4 steps to get back to the starting point. There are 2 sets of instructions about turning around and the same amount of steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
